alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 20 at 2:55PM MDT until June 20 at 3:30PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM MDT FOR CENTRAL SHERIDAN COUNTY... At 254 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles northeast of Ranchester to near Sheridan to near Fort Phil Kearny Historical Site, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters in Dayton reported hail up to quarter size with these storms. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Sheridan, Big Horn, Story and Banner. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
